III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in
section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
A CAP was submitted and approved on 6/30/2022 regarding a special investigation
that was initiated on 5/24/2022. The investigation was initiated due to an allegation
that the agency did not submit closed adoption files to DHHS timely. A violation of
ADM 1030 was cited. The agency is currently in compliance with ADM 1030 as all
closed adoption files has been submitted to the local DHHS offices as required.
VI. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency does not have any licensed foster homes or relative placements.
Chief Administrator Assessment:
The Chief Administrator assessment was reviewed onsite. The Program Director
reported that LAS is fortunate to have a quality manager within their employ who is
dedicated to assisting their staff to stay on top of trends and continually find ways to
leverage the tools available for on-going data and continuous quality improvement
measures. It was reported that LAS also engages in a monthly Quality Assurance

Performance Improvement (QAPI) process as well as quarterly Performance
Management Plans (PMP) to monitor quality outcomes, the need for action on
regulatory and compliance issues and to analyze survey data from their clients. She
said they are fully staffed, and that the agency continues to work with local DHHS
offices for adoption referrals.
Interviews:
Two adoption specialists were interviewed. They reported being employed at the
agency for 10 and 5 and a half years. They enjoy working at the agency because
they love what they do and having the support of their supervisors and coworkers.
One worker suggested having more team celebrations. They said the best part of
the agency is that it is ever changing, and the breakout groups are great because
people get the opportunity to discuss areas of concerns and make a difference in
their adoptive families lives.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. We
recommend that Legacy Adoption services – East be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
